org.apache.spark.network.shuffle

Class ExternalShuffleClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.spark.network.shuffle.ShuffleClient
      • org.apache.spark.network.shuffle.ExternalShuffleClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MesosExternalShuffleClient

    public class ExternalShuffleClient
extends ShuffleClient
    Client for reading shuffle blocks which points to an external (outside of executor) server. This is instead of reading shuffle blocks directly from other executors (via BlockTransferService), which has the downside of losing the shuffle data if we lose the executors.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      protected org.apache.spark.network.client.TransportClientFactory clientFactory

      ExternalShuffleClient(org.apache.spark.network.util.TransportConf conf, org.apache.spark.network.sasl.SecretKeyHolder secretKeyHolder, boolean saslEnabled, boolean saslEncryptionEnabled)
      Creates an external shuffle client, with SASL optionally enabled.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void checkInit() 
      void close() 
      void fetchBlocks(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String execId, java.lang.String[] blockIds, BlockFetchingListener listener)
      Fetch a sequence of blocks from a remote node asynchronously, Note that this API takes a sequence so the implementation can batch requests, and does not return a future so the underlying implementation can invoke onBlockFetchSuccess as soon as the data of a block is fetched, rather than waiting for all blocks to be fetched.
      void init(java.lang.String appId)
      Initializes the ShuffleClient, specifying this Executor's appId.
      void registerWithShuffleServer(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String execId, ExecutorShuffleInfo executorInfo)
      Registers this executor with an external shuffle server.

      • fetchBlocks

        public void fetchBlocks(java.lang.String host,
                        int port,
                        java.lang.String execId,
                        java.lang.String[] blockIds,
                        BlockFetchingListener listener)
        Description copied from class: ShuffleClient
        Fetch a sequence of blocks from a remote node asynchronously, Note that this API takes a sequence so the implementation can batch requests, and does not return a future so the underlying implementation can invoke onBlockFetchSuccess as soon as the data of a block is fetched, rather than waiting for all blocks to be fetched.
        Specified by:
        fetchBlocks in class ShuffleClient

      • registerWithShuffleServer

        public void registerWithShuffleServer(java.lang.String host,
                                      int port,
                                      java.lang.String execId,
                                      ExecutorShuffleInfo executorInfo)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Registers this executor with an external shuffle server. This registration is required to inform the shuffle server about where and how we store our shuffle files.
        Parameters:
        host - Host of shuffle server.
        port - Port of shuffle server.
        execId - This Executor's id.
        executorInfo - Contains all info necessary for the service to find our shuffle files.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • close

        public void close()
